**Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms**

**Scripture Title:** *Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms*. Author unknown, approximately dated to the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Shangqing (Upper Clarity) tradition. Two scrolls.

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms, Scroll One*

#### *The Hidden Primordial Writ of the Lofty One from the Celestial Realm*

The Supreme Perfected Jade Guardian King of Upper Clarity and the Grand Minister of State commanded the Master of Lofty Dawn, the Azure Lad of the Jade Gate of the Eastern Sea, to receive the *Hidden Primordial Writ of the Released Grades from the Outer Realms of the Supreme Jade Emperor*.

This Dao is most wondrous, born before the Nine Mysteries, forming the natural chapters of soaring dark-purple *qi*. Its numinous writ manifests marvels, shining brilliantly in Upper Clarity. After ninety thousand kalpas, it was inscribed upon the Green Jasper Realm’s Spirit Bird Mountain, set upon the Eastern Florescence’s cavern and the Dark Garden’s piled stones to the north. Its flowing radiance illumines the Great Void; sun and moon flank its glow. The Five Dawns bear its spirit; the Eight Simplicities intertwine. The Four Convergences weave mist; flying auroras veil the *qi*. The maidens of golden splendor and the lads of jade dawn—three hundred each—attend and guard the sacred writ.

The Heavenly Consorts waft incense; the numinous winds scatter truth. Flying dragons and coursing beasts array before the Jade Pass. Vermilion phoenixes preen their wings; divine simurghs shade the dark. The Western Florescence hosts its rites; ten thousand sages bow in the celestial court.

On the first day of the third month of the inaugural year of the Central August Era, at the hour when Heavenly Virtue aligns, the Azure Lad, Minister of the Uppermost, purified himself in the empty mountains. He swore a golden-green pact with Heaven and received from the Supreme One the writ. He traversed the Six Realms, trod the famed mountains, circled the Five Peaks, and walked the sources of all rivers. The Five Thearchs lent their wings; his numinous chariot descended. The hosts of the Ten Realms and the assembled sages feasted in the vast court. He explored the remote and obscure, grasped the formless, and channeled flowing essence to illumine the Dao. The Great Yang unleashed lightning to manifest its power. The Seven Primes coursed through the purple void; the Eight Effulgences reined their steeds to ascend and fly. He chanted the jade tones of the Outer Realms, releasing the divine grades into subtlety. He commanded the Five Elders to order their ranks and summoned the ten thousand perfected to gather. The Nine Numinous harmonized; the Three Radiant merged their splendor. The Cinnabar Numinous announced auspices; the Supreme One oversaw and reflected. His rank ascended to Upper Minister; his name was inscribed in the Purple Dawn. His body was clad in a nine-hued frost-silk robe; he wore the flowing, luminous, cavernous, primordial writ of the Radiant Effulgence. His crown, the Hundred-Transformations Numinous Treasure, bore cascading bells. Ninefold cinnabar clouds entwined him. The golden-florescence jade maidens and the purple-dawn lads—three thousand each—attended the Lord.

Thus, the Celestial Mystery sounded its rhythm; the mold of virtue responded to the true. He was entrusted with the transformation of the upper realms, governing the Nine Heavens, overseeing all under Heaven, and universally leading the ten thousand immortals. The registers of life and death—nothing, however minute, escaped his purview.

The Lord’s virtue was lofty, his Dao complete. He roamed the Jade Clarity, serene and luminous. The Seven Primes shone and scattered; the Five Elders attended his spirit. The Three Luminants flanked his radiance; the Nine Thearchs aligned their chariots. Flying mists formed a purple canopy; dark clouds arose in the void. Jade maidens raised their voices; the divine net resounded. Dragons intoned; phoenixes sang. The vast court swelled with celestial music. Auroras encircled the sun; flowing lightning quickened essence. Radiant lights intermingled; divine candles merged their brilliance. Alone, he wielded the tally of the numinous writ, his hand brandishing the banner to command demonic spirits. He wandered the Purple Clouds’ palace, lingered in the Azure Florescence’s chambers. He overawed the Six Heavens with his advent; he severed the myriad spirits from their hordes of malevolence. He gathered the later disciples upon golden tablets, collated the azure registers from all directions. He summoned the ten thousand thearchs to the winding script, expounded the precious formulas in the wondrous chapters. He unfolded the Nine Mysteries through the kalpas, unraveled the arcane to enlighten the benighted. He composed the *Standing Alone* to equal the perfected; he enforced the Four Poles to restrain transgressions. He commanded the Four Offices to execute punishments, empowered the Five Thearchs to correct wrongs. Universally, he governed the boundless. The Four Quarters, the Six Realms, the Five Peaks, and the famed mountains—myriad billions of perfected beings—all submitted to the Azure Palace and served the Upper Minister.

Such a treasure writ is the Supreme One’s chapter of mysterious emptiness, naturally formed. It gathers the soaring dark-purple *qi* into hidden writ, releasing the thirty-six tones of the Outer Realms’ grades. It establishes the Six Realms within the offices of the Five Elders, to be practiced by those of the Dao who fly as immortals. The jade tones are crystalline and clear; the wondrous meanings are subtle and profound. All manifest the rhythms of the Supreme August and the Primordial Mystery. The Four Convergences and Eight Reaches intertwine to form its sounds. Its true purport is difficult to fathom; its principles are hard to trace. Unless one is of the purple womb’s woven network, the jade treasury’s unobstructed freshness, and the nine apertures’ receptivity to the numinous, one cannot grasp its subtle rhythms or penetrate its jade tones.

The Supreme One guarded this secret closely. Thus, it was transmitted mouth to mouth. The Nine Heavens appointed the Left Assistant to hold the tally in the Immortal Capital. To the right, they placed the Jade Gentlemen Attendants and the Five Directions’ Numinous Officials—fifty thousand each—to safeguard the treasure writ. Jade lads and maidens held towels and attended incense. Dark numinous purple canopies scattered mist through the distant court. The assembled perfected shone brilliantly in Upper Clarity.

Thus, the Supreme Jade Emperor and all the sagely beings, on the eight seasonal days, ascend the jasper chambers to perform rites and chant the tones. The jade echoes ring clear, shaking the Nine Heavens.

On the day this writ is inscribed, the Five Stars emerge from their lodgings; the Seven Primes halt their radiance. The Five Thearchs float in their positions; the ten thousand immortals attend the court. A thousand demons lose their sight; hordes of devils extinguish their essence. His might subdues the Six Realms; countless domains are pacified. The divine and wondrous transformations defy description. Its gaze flows through a hundred million kalpas without fading; the great transformation renews itself ever anew. Its numinous excellence is towering and majestic, beyond naming.

Whoever possesses this scripture has had their name inscribed in the imperial registers before their birth, destined to emerge as an immortal. Some celestial perfected descend to bestow this writ; others, through worldly karmic conditions, encounter a scripture master. Dreams echo with numinous responses; their spirit merges with the true. Having received the jade tones, one should burn incense in a secluded chamber, perform rites, and cultivate practice. Chanting it once summons the ten thousand perfected to gather; the Five Elders attend in form. Heavenly demons bow their heads; a thousand demons lose their essence. His might shakes the Six Realms; he summons immortals and draws the perfected near.

After nine years, the Three Primes ascend to the celestial chambers, descending in cloud-borne chariots to soar through the Upper Clarity. Even if one possesses this scripture yet fails to cultivate its practice in the world, merely revering it with sincere devotion will summon twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens to attend and guard one’s person, warding off the ten thousand calamities. They subdue weapons of war, and the thousand afflictions and myriad harms dare not rashly intrude. The Five Emperors stand guard, enabling one to attain the rank of lesser immortal. Alternatively, one may undergo bodily transformation and cyclic rebirth, ascending into the numinous chambers—though one may not yet assume office in the Jade Void or wander among the Three Clarities.

**Thirty-Six Celestial Registers of the Six Realms**

The Five Directions of Heaven and Earth each possess governing hues of hardness and softness, preventing their dissolution. The earth extends twenty billion miles deep, where it receives moisture; beneath this moisture lies another twenty billion miles of golden millet marsh; below that, twenty billion miles of adamantine iron marsh; deeper still, twenty billion miles of watery marsh; descending eighty billion miles further, one reaches the great wind marsh; and five hundred twenty billion miles beyond that, the cosmic net sustains Heaven and Earth, ensuring they do not collapse—just as the sun, moon, and stars are upheld by the wind. Scholars who remain ignorant of the depths and hues beneath the earth will find the Five Emperors unable to extend their protection beyond the borders of foreign lands.

**Eastern Realm: The Land of Fuyudai**
Beyond ninety thousand miles to the easternmost extremity lies the Wasteland of Haolin, where the kingdom of Heluoti resides. Its land is perfectly round, its soil as fresh as azure rouge, devoid of mountains or hills, spanning nine hundred thousand miles in breadth. The people of this land stand two *zhang* tall and live four hundred years. The kingdom possesses six celestial registers, which the Supreme Highest established among the foreign Hu elders. The Supreme Highest often chants these registers to transform the Hu elders, revealing to them the teachings of immortality in foreign lands. If the people of this land observe rites and recite these registers, they attain a lifespan of four hundred years, free from premature death. Scholars who study the hues of foreign lands and constantly chant the six registers will summon the immortal officials of the Hu elders to guard their persons. After nine years, they naturally gain passage to the land of Heluoti, converse with the Hu elders, transform their bodies to fly through the air, and wander the easternmost realms.

**The Six Registers of the Eastern Land of Heluoti:**
1. First Register: *Chan Ayiti Nawei*
2. Second Register: *Yue Jia Moxu Yunchi*
3. Third Register: *Tan Zhen Shizhe Yuantuo*
4. Fourth Register: *Gao Bojun Yun Wuzi*
5. Fifth Register: *Xi Jin Lingfa Poyi*
6. Sixth Register: *Sheliding Quni Tai*

In the land of Heluoti, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Hu elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth. By cultivating this Way, one summons the immortal officials of foreign lands to guard one’s person. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, one should inscribe the six registers in azure ink, recite them once while facing east, and knock the teeth nine times. Chant the six registers six times each, then close the eyes, compose the body, and settle the spirit. Abandon all stray thoughts and visualize the boundless eastern realm, the land of Heluoti, clearly and vividly. Envision countless Hu elder immortal officials arriving to pay homage, reciting the foreign registers. Then softly intone the prayer:

*"The bounds of Heaven and Earth unfold,
Eight directions shine in clarity,
Vast and boundless insight,
The names of foreign lands,
Celestial registers transform through sound,
Qi coalesces into spirit,
Summoning immortals and drawing the perfected near,
Myriad hosts gather as one,
Tracing the subtle and profound,
Mirroring the formless,
Above and below resound in harmony,
Within and without grow solemn and pure,
Azure mists and flying wheels
Come to aid my form,
Bearing me aloft,
To the northern audience in the Jade Capital."*

Conclude by swallowing the qi nine times. This is the supreme method of the celestial registers of foreign lands, a practice of divine immortals. After nine years of cultivation, one summons immortal officials, gains spiritual insight into the subtle, communicates with the divine, and ascends into the void to rise to Heaven in broad daylight.

**Southern Realm: The Land of Yanfuli**
Beyond three hundred thousand miles to the southernmost extremity lies the Radiant Yang Wilderness, where the kingdom of Yishata resides. Its land is vast and level, without elevation or depression, its soil crimson, spanning eight hundred ten thousand miles in breadth. The people of this land stand two *zhang* and four *chi* tall and live three hundred sixty years. The kingdom possesses six celestial registers, which the Supreme Highest established among the foreign Yue elders. The Supreme Highest often chants these registers to transform the Yue elders, revealing to them the teachings of immortality in their land. If the people of this land observe rites and recite these registers, they attain a lifespan of three hundred sixty years, free from premature death. Scholars who study the hues of foreign lands and constantly chant the six registers will summon the immortal officials to guard their persons. After nine years, they naturally gain passage to the land of Yishata, converse with the Yue elders, transform their bodies within the vermilion palace, and soar through the southern yang realms.

**The Six Registers of the Southern Land of Yishata:**
1. First Register: *Nan Weina Xihan Luo*
2. Second Register: *Huan Molan Yulan Bo*
3. Third Register: *Le Feng Le Yuming Sha*
4. Fourth Register: *Hui Su Jie Qi Feituo*
5. Fifth Register: *Gen Zhi Sui Bai Wuhe*
6. Sixth Register: *Ying Chong Du Xuan Jingche*

In the land of Yishata, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Yue elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth. By cultivating this Way, one summons the flying immortal officials of foreign lands to guard one’s person. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the six registers in vermilion ink, enter a chamber, face south, and recite them. Knock the teeth nine times and chant the six registers six times each.

When finished, close the eyes to settle the spirit and stabilize the qi, casting aside all stray thoughts. Visualize the boundless, infinite realm of the southern direction, its clarity and luminosity fully revealed. Envision the countless Yue elders and immortal officials arriving to attend one’s person. Then softly recite the incantation:

*"Lofty numina descend their radiance,
Scattering transformation through the Vermilion Palace.
The flowing tones of the six registers
Congeal into a cinnabar countenance.
Hosts of immortals arrive in audience,
Paired with the true mandate in duality.
Penetrating vision of the Eight Luminaries,
Eyes behold the Flowering Chamber.
Divided effulgences ascend to the Upper Clarity,
Emerging from azure, entering into yellow.
Five-hued streaming essences
Become my luminous light.
I roam the Six Lands,
Ascend to the Jade Hall,
Receive the immortal Dharma robes,
Fly in azure feathered garments,
Girded with flowing gold and intertwining sashes,
Adorned with phoenix-script purple insignia.
Attaining unity with the Emperor in truth,
My form shines in the Jade Capital."*

When finished, swallow the qi nine times and cease.

Practicing this for nine years will summon the Yue elders and immortal officials of the southern lands to guard and attend one’s form. They will perceive the hidden and fathom the void, conversing with the spirits. Flying clouds and dark dragons will descend to welcome the adept.

**The Land of Junayi in the West**
Beyond seventy myriad li to the farthest reaches of the west lies the White Mound, the land of Junayi. Its register is inscribed as the *Niviro Lǔnā* nation. The terrain is marked by towering mounds, bordering the Western Gate of Heaven. The earth’s hue is white as jade, spanning sixty-eight myriad li in breadth. Its people stand sixteen feet tall and live for six hundred years. The land possesses six register tones, which are the exalted teachings bestowed upon the Di elders of foreign lands. The exalted ones constantly chant and sing these tones to transform the Di elders, revealing to them the land’s teachings of deathlessness. If the people of this land all perform rites and recite these tones, they attain a lifespan of six hundred years, free from premature death. Scholars who know the earth’s hues of foreign lands and constantly chant, recite, and cultivate these practices will naturally summon the Di elders and immortal officials to guard their persons. After nine years, they will effortlessly journey to the land of *Niviro Lǔnā*, converse with the Di elders, and soar through the void, frolicking in the White Mound.

**The Six Registers of the Western Land of Niviro Lǔnā:**
1. First Register: *Tayī Āsēnhēgēn*
2. Second Register: *Jīnluó Guójiā Móqiān*
3. Third Register: *Póyī Nífàn Bǎozhēn*
4. Fourth Register: *Líkuí Tílán Pózhēn*
5. Fifth Register: *Shìfēn Nàmào Lǜchén*
6. Sixth Register: *Tíwò Shārù Huátián*

In the land of *Niviro Lǔnā* in the west, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Di elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan whose radiance equals that of the sun and moon. By cultivating this Way, one summons the flying immortal officials of foreign lands to guard one’s person. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the six registers in white ink, enter a chamber, face due west, and recite them. Knock the teeth nine times and chant the six registers six times each.

When finished, close the eyes to settle the spirit and stabilize the will, casting aside all external distractions. Visualize the boundless, infinite realm of the western direction, its clarity fully revealed. Envision the countless Di elders and immortal officials arriving to attend one’s person. Then softly recite the incantation:

*"Heavenly tones, subtle numina,
Void and subtle, they command the spirits.
The Six Divisions of the Jade Land
Appoint the One as true.
Transforming the foreign lands in harmony,
Disseminating the registers to delight the immortals.
Lofty numina curve their radiance—
I attain spontaneity.
Riding the void, soaring aloft,
Alighting upon the Dragon Terrace.
Roaming and gazing without bound,
Darkly ascending the Five Mornings.
My brilliance equals the qi,
My mandate governs the exalted.
Through countless kalpas of fate,
I eternally preserve long existence."*

When finished, swallow the qi nine times and cease.

Practicing this for nine years will summon the Di elders and immortal officials of the western lands to guard one’s person. They will perceive the unseen future and commune with the true and numinous, descending with azure chariots to ascend to the Jade Clarity.

---

**The Land of Xuntaluo in the North**
Beyond fifty myriad li to the farthest reaches of the north lies the Dark Yin Court, the land of Xuntaluo. Its register is inscribed as the *Xuntaluo* nation. The land stretches long and flows level, its earth black and lustrous, spanning fifty-eight myriad li in breadth. Its people stand twelve feet tall and live for three hundred years. The land possesses six register tones, which are the exalted teachings bestowed upon the Qiang elders of foreign lands. The exalted ones constantly chant and sing these tones to transform the Qiang elders, revealing to them the land’s teachings of deathlessness. If the people of this land all perform rites and recite these tones, they attain a lifespan of three hundred years, free from premature death. Scholars who know the earth’s hues of foreign lands and constantly chant, recite, and cultivate these practices will summon the Qiang elders and immortal officials to guard their persons. After nine years, they will effortlessly journey to the land of *Xuntaluo*, converse with the Qiang elders, soar through the void, and feast in the Dark Yin Court.

**The Six Registers of the Northern Land of Xuntaluo:**
1. First Register: *Yōuluó Yùtóu Tā’ā*
2. Second Register: *Yōuzhēn Shìwéi Guāngnà*
3. Third Register: *Pǐnyù Dìngjué Shìhé*
4. Fourth Register: *Yīnyè Bǎokāi Lùshā*
5. Fifth Register: *Fǎguāng Jǐngliàng Guóluó*
6. Sixth Register: *Bōmì Wéijiāhē*

In the land of *Xuntaluo* in the north, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Qiang elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan equal to the numinous Seven Origins. By cultivating this Way, one summons the immortal officials of foreign lands to attend. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the six registers in black ink, enter a chamber, face north, and recite them. Knock the teeth nine times and chant the six registers six times each.

When finished, close the eyes to settle the spirit and stabilize the will, casting aside all external distractions. Visualize the boundless, infinite realm of the northern direction, its clarity fully revealed. Envision the countless Qiang elders and immortal officials arriving to attend one’s person. Then softly recite the incantation:

*"Northern darkness congeals in Luo,
The Seven Origins exhale their essence.
Disseminating the registers, fasting in qi,
The Six Lands establish their names.
The Qiang elders, ever pure,
Receive the Dharma’s transformation and numinous power.
Exalted immortals command the mandate—
I am endowed with formlessness.
Qi flows in tandem,
Penetrating the Eight Darknesses.
Flying immortals arrive in audience,
Lush and misty in the Purple Court.
Cloud chariots and feathered canopies,
Verdant mists and cinnabar chariots,
Convey me upward
To ascend to the Jade Clarity."*

Upon completion, swallow the qi nine times and cease. Practicing this for nine years will summon the Qiang elders and immortal officials of the northern direction to guard one’s person, allowing one to trace the obscure and fathom the yet-unseen, commune with the perfected and attain numinous power, soar through the mysterious void, and ascend to the Purple Dawn. Above the Nine Heavens of the upper direction, within the clear yang and empty space, where there is no color, no form, no shape, no shadow—there lies the realm of the primordial essence and the naturally arising Azure Chaos, where azure qi serves as the fragrance of the world. Boundless above, it covers the four directions of all heavens, forming the root from which the Most High Jade Emperor and the myriad sage emperors and perfected beings receive life. Without age, without limit, only kalpas serve as years. Within this empty void, there are also the Six Resonances, established by the Primordial Beginning as the natural ranks of the Perfected Emperor. The Most High intones and chants these sounds to extend the lives of the host of immortals, allowing them to know that the mysterious void holds boundless perfected beings. As the Jade Emperor and the ten thousand emperors of that realm all pay homage and chant these sounds, they attain limitless longevity. Those who study and know the color of the empty void, practicing through intoning and recitation, will summon the descent of the Three Origins, with the Five Emperors visiting their chamber to bestow upon them the numinous sounds. After nine years, they will be able to ride the void and mount the floating clouds, ascending to the Great Void of Jade Clarity.

The realm of the naturally arising Azure Chaos of the primordial essence in the upper direction:
First Rank Resonance, sounding: *Qiongyao Fenlu Dingyin*.
Second Rank Resonance, sounding: *Fengyun Landan Baolin*.
Third Rank Resonance, sounding: *Yaoliang Guangdong Zisen*.
Fourth Rank Resonance, sounding: *Yuannai Jingru Kongqiong*.
Fifth Rank Resonance, sounding: *He’a Fangbihu Ping*.
Sixth Rank Resonance, sounding: *Qiyao Qi Fei Yuanqing*.

The realm of the naturally arising Azure Chaos of the primordial essence emits the Six Ranks of Resonance to mark the truth of the Jade Emperor of Supreme Clarity. Those who know these sounds will soar through the Jade Void, and the myriad immortals will come to pay homage. On the days of one’s original destiny, the year-star, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the Six Ranks of Resonance in azure script, enter the chamber, face the year-star, and ingest them. Knock the teeth nine times and intone the Six Resonances six times each. Upon completion, close the eyes, calm the spirit, settle the will, and cast aside all thoughts. Visualize the boundless Supreme Clarity of the uppermost clear yang and empty space, where there is no color, no form, no shape, no shadow—only the luminous clarity of the empty void, suffused with dense azure qi descending to crown one’s person. Then softly recite the incantation:

*"Primordial Beginning, naturally arising,
Azure yang dense and dark,
Mysterious transformation of the empty void,
Boundless and formless,
Congealing qi to form the realm,
Fragrant world as its name,
Encompassing all heavens,
Universally nurturing the ten thousand spirits.
Cloud chambers and golden nets,
Towering in Supreme Clarity,
The Six Ranks emit their positions,
Inscribing the primordial essence.
Jade sounds penetrate the subtle,
Mysterious echoes resound in clarity.
Intoning and chanting issue forth,
The Perfected Emperors descend to the court.
Curved reflections hang like trailing branches—
I partake of the supreme numen,
Equal in rank to Heaven,
The Three Luminaries unite in brightness,
Forever preserving the Great Void,
Unshaken through the kalpas."*

Upon completion, swallow the qi nine times and cease. Practicing this for nine years will cause the Three Origins to descend and bestow the true sounds upon one, granting a flying auroral cinnabar chariot to one’s person, allowing flight through the Great Void and ascent to Jade Clarity. This is a most exalted and secret method, recorded in the nameless golden texts and the azure characters of Supreme Clarity. It must not be practiced without authorization. Those who recklessly transmit it to others will bring calamity upon their seven generations, incur punishment from the Three Officials, forfeit their own lives, and lose all hope of immortality. Adhere strictly to the regulations and guard this knowledge with care.

Beneath the central lands lies the vast Windy Marsh, extending five hundred twenty billion miles from the earth. The firm axis of the earth’s roots governs it, preventing its fall. The soil there is the color of golden essence. The resonance of the central lands is called the realm of the Treasured Perfection of Great Harmony and Boundless Life. Mount Kunlun of the central peaks stands at its center, bearing the alternate names of all heavens. Above it lies the Seven Jeweled Pearl Palace of the Dark Garden, where the ends of heaven meet, serving as the abode of the perfected and flying immortals. The central lands span one hundred twenty billion miles in circumference. The people there are nine feet tall, all practicing the arts of guiding and pulling, and live for one thousand two hundred years. The land possesses the Six Resonances, established by the Most High as the ranks of the central lands. The Jade Emperor and the Most High intone and chant these sounds to transform the Qiang elders of the central lands, allowing them to know that their realm holds the teachings of deathlessness. If the people of that land all cultivate the Dao of Supreme Clarity, practicing rites and recitations, they will live for one thousand two hundred years, free from untimely death. Those who study and know the earth’s color of the central lands, practicing through intoning and recitation, will have the Qiang elder immortal officials guard their persons. After nine years, they will naturally converse with the Qiang elders, ascend to the Great Void, and soar to Supreme Clarity.

The realm of the Treasured Perfection of Great Harmony and Boundless Life:
First Rank Resonance, sounding: *Dingshi Yinjie Ronghe*.
Second Rank Resonance, sounding: *Zhongbao Zhu Ruolaihua*.
Third Rank Resonance, sounding: *Guangyuan Yuanli Yun’a*.
Fourth Rank Resonance, sounding: *Tiaoqiong Fen Jin Shiluo*.
Fifth Rank Resonance, sounding: *Dongling Yin Jieshi Tuo*.
Sixth Rank Resonance, sounding: *Jingen Bao Zhuyang Po*.

The realm of the Treasured Perfection of Great Harmony and Boundless Life emits the Six Ranks of Resonance to establish the titles of the Qiang elders. Those who know these sounds will live as long as heaven and earth. Practicing this Dao will summon the Qiang elder immortal officials to pay homage to one’s person. On the days of the year-star, one’s original destiny, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the Six Ranks of Resonance in yellow script, enter the chamber, face one’s original destiny, and ingest them. Knock the teeth nine times and intone the sounds of the six lands six times each. Upon completion, close the eyes, calm the spirit, settle the will, and cast aside all thoughts. Visualize the vast Windy Marsh beneath the central lands, plunging five hundred twenty billion miles into the abyss, its clarity fully revealed. Envision the countless Qiang elder immortal officials arriving to attend one’s person. Then recite the prayer:

*"Central perfection, myriad emperors and mysterious numina,
The Nine Heavens bestow their canon,
Congealing qi and condensing essence,
Vast and yellow, the court of boundless fathoms.
The central lands emit their ranks,
Dividing the sounds into six names.
Jade faces the luminous void,
Penetrating the subtle and entering the azure.
Flowing perfection spreads forth,
Cultivating my form,
Transforming into Great Harmony,
Treasured perfection, advantageous and upright.
Below, it pierces the abyssal depths;
Above, it ascends to Jade Clarity."*

When finished, swallow the qi nine times and cease. Practicing this for nine years, the Perfected One descends to bestow upon the practitioner the true sounds, enabling converse with the Qiang elder immortal officials, riding the void to ascend to the Court of the Celestial Dawn. The Highest establishes the Six States’ ranked inscriptions, transforming them into thirty-six sounds. At the inception of the Primordial Beginning, the texts were inscribed in gold on tablets, each placed within a state, now all sealed within their borders or upon the sacred peaks of the Five Marchmounts. The sounds of the Central Lands, for instance, correspond to the northern face of the Jasper Orchard’s Piled Stones. These divine texts are each attended by three hundred Purple Aurora Jade Lads and Great Flower Jade Maidens, who serve and tend the incense.

By ancient decree, after ten thousand kalpas, they are transmitted to those of the highest Perfection. Without one’s name inscribed on the Emperor’s golden tablets or the Jade Clarity’s green script, one cannot receive these texts. **Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms**

**Scripture Title:** *Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms*. Author unknown, approximately dated to the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Shangqing (Upper Clarity) tradition. Two scrolls.

**Source:** *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

### *Upper Clarity Scripture of the Released Grades of the Azure Lad from the Outer Realms, Scroll One*

#### *The Hidden Primordial Writ of the Lofty One from the Celestial Realm*

The Supreme Perfected Jade Guardian King of Upper Clarity and the Grand Minister of State commanded the Master of Lofty Dawn, the Azure Lad of the Jade Gate of the Eastern Sea, to receive the *Hidden Primordial Writ of the Released Grades from the Outer Realms of the Supreme Jade Emperor*.

This Dao is most wondrous, born before the Nine Mysteries, forming the natural chapters of soaring dark-purple *qi*. Its numinous writ manifests marvels, shining brilliantly in Upper Clarity. After ninety thousand kalpas, it was inscribed upon the Green Jasper Realm’s Spirit Bird Mountain, set upon the Eastern Florescence’s cavern and the Dark Garden’s piled stones to the north. Its flowing radiance illumines the Great Void; sun and moon flank its glow. The Five Dawns bear its spirit; the Eight Simplicities intertwine. The Four Convergences weave mist; flying auroras veil the *qi*. The maidens of golden splendor and the lads of jade dawn—three hundred each—attend and guard the sacred writ.

The Heavenly Consorts waft incense; the numinous winds scatter truth. Flying dragons and coursing beasts array before the Jade Pass. Vermilion phoenixes preen their wings; divine simurghs shade the dark. The Western Florescence hosts its rites; ten thousand sages bow in the celestial court.

On the first day of the third month of the inaugural year of the Central August Era, at the hour when Heavenly Virtue aligns, the Azure Lad, Minister of the Uppermost, purified himself in the empty mountains. He swore a golden-green pact with Heaven and received from the Supreme One the writ. He traversed the Six Realms, trod the famed mountains, circled the Five Peaks, and walked the sources of all rivers. The Five Thearchs lent their wings; his numinous chariot descended. The hosts of the Ten Realms and the assembled sages feasted in the vast court. He explored the remote and obscure, grasped the formless, and channeled flowing essence to illumine the Dao. The Great Yang unleashed lightning to manifest its power. The Seven Primes coursed through the purple void; the Eight Effulgences reined their steeds to ascend and fly. He chanted the jade tones of the Outer Realms, releasing the divine grades into subtlety. He commanded the Five Elders to order their ranks and summoned the ten thousand perfected to gather. The Nine Numinous harmonized; the Three Radiant merged their splendor. The Cinnabar Numinous announced auspices; the Supreme One oversaw and reflected. His rank ascended to Upper Minister; his name was inscribed in the Purple Dawn. His body was clad in a nine-hued frost-silk robe; he wore the flowing, luminous, cavernous, primordial writ of the Radiant Effulgence. His crown, the Hundred-Transformations Numinous Treasure, bore cascading bells. Ninefold cinnabar clouds entwined him. The golden-florescence jade maidens and the purple-dawn lads—three thousand each—attended the Lord.

Thus, the Celestial Mystery sounded its rhythm; the mold of virtue responded to the true. He was entrusted with the transformation of the upper realms, governing the Nine Heavens, overseeing all under Heaven, and universally leading the ten thousand immortals. The registers of life and death—nothing, however minute, escaped his purview.

The Lord’s virtue was lofty, his Dao complete. He roamed the Jade Clarity, serene and luminous. The Seven Primes shone and scattered; the Five Elders attended his spirit. The Three Luminants flanked his radiance; the Nine Thearchs aligned their chariots. Flying mists formed a purple canopy; dark clouds arose in the void. Jade maidens raised their voices; the divine net resounded. Dragons intoned; phoenixes sang. The vast court swelled with celestial music. Auroras encircled the sun; flowing lightning quickened essence. Radiant lights intermingled; divine candles merged their brilliance. Alone, he wielded the tally of the numinous writ, his hand brandishing the banner to command demonic spirits. He wandered the Purple Clouds’ palace, lingered in the Azure Florescence’s chambers. He overawed the Six Heavens with his advent; he severed the myriad spirits from their hordes of malevolence. He gathered the later disciples upon golden tablets, collated the azure registers from all directions. He summoned the ten thousand thearchs to the winding script, expounded the precious formulas in the wondrous chapters. He unfolded the Nine Mysteries through the kalpas, unraveled the arcane to enlighten the benighted. He composed the *Standing Alone* to equal the perfected; he enforced the Four Poles to restrain transgressions. He commanded the Four Offices to execute punishments, empowered the Five Thearchs to correct wrongs. Universally, he governed the boundless. The Four Quarters, the Six Realms, the Five Peaks, and the famed mountains—myriad billions of perfected beings—all submitted to the Azure Palace and served the Upper Minister.

Such a treasure writ is the Supreme One’s chapter of mysterious emptiness, naturally formed. It gathers the soaring dark-purple *qi* into hidden writ, releasing the thirty-six tones of the Outer Realms’ grades. It establishes the Six Realms within the offices of the Five Elders, to be practiced by those of the Dao who fly as immortals. The jade tones are crystalline and clear; the wondrous meanings are subtle and profound. All manifest the rhythms of the Supreme August and the Primordial Mystery. The Four Convergences and Eight Reaches intertwine to form its sounds. Its true purport is difficult to fathom; its principles are hard to trace. Unless one is of the purple womb’s woven network, the jade treasury’s unobstructed freshness, and the nine apertures’ receptivity to the numinous, one cannot grasp its subtle rhythms or penetrate its jade tones.

The Supreme One guarded this secret closely. Thus, it was transmitted mouth to mouth. The Nine Heavens appointed the Left Assistant to hold the tally in the Immortal Capital. To the right, they placed the Jade Gentlemen Attendants and the Five Directions’ Numinous Officials—fifty thousand each—to safeguard the treasure writ. Jade lads and maidens held towels and attended incense. Dark numinous purple canopies scattered mist through the distant court. The assembled perfected shone brilliantly in Upper Clarity.

Thus, the Supreme Jade Emperor and all the sagely beings, on the eight seasonal days, ascend the jasper chambers to perform rites and chant the tones. The jade echoes ring clear, shaking the Nine Heavens.

On the day this writ is inscribed, the Five Stars emerge from their lodgings; the Seven Primes halt their radiance. The Five Thearchs float in their positions; the ten thousand immortals attend the court. A thousand demons lose their sight; hordes of devils extinguish their essence. His might subdues the Six Realms; countless domains are pacified. The divine and wondrous transformations defy description. Its gaze flows through a hundred million kalpas without fading; the great transformation renews itself ever anew. Its numinous excellence is towering and majestic, beyond naming.

Whoever possesses this scripture has had their name inscribed in the imperial registers before their birth, destined to emerge as an immortal. Some celestial perfected descend to bestow this writ; others, through worldly karmic conditions, encounter a scripture master. Dreams echo with numinous responses; their spirit merges with the true. Having received the jade tones, one should burn incense in a secluded chamber, perform rites, and cultivate practice. Chanting it once summons the ten thousand perfected to gather; the Five Elders attend in form. Heavenly demons bow their heads; a thousand demons lose their essence. His might shakes the Six Realms; he summons immortals and draws the perfected near.

chunks.original_text: 九年，三元诣房，降致云舆，飞行上清。 但有是经，於世不得修行，精心供养，则给玉童玉女各十二人，侍卫左右，营护有经者身，辟却万灾，禳伏甲兵，千患万害，不敢妄干，五帝防卫，克得下仙，或尸变轮转，升入灵房，但不得受於玉虚之任，游三清之中耳。 六国品铭三十六首 天地五方，皆有制御刚柔之色，使不得落。 其地深二十亿万里，得润泽； 润泽下二十亿万里，得金粟泽； 金栗泽下二十亿万里，得金刚铁泽； 金刚铁泽深入二十亿万里，得水泽； 水泽下八十亿万里，得大风泽； 大风泽下五百二十亿万里，纲维天地，制使不陷，如今日月星辰，为风所持也。 学者不知地下之境润色深浅，则五帝不过兆身於外国之境也。 东方弗于逮，九万里之外极，豪林之墟，其国音铭呵罗提之国，国地形正员，土色如碧脂之鲜，无有山阜，广狭九十万里。 其国人形长二丈，寿四百岁。 国有六音之铭，是高上始气置於外国胡老之品。 高上常吟歌其音，以化胡老之人，令知外国有不死之教。 如其国人皆行礼而诵其音，是得四百岁之寿，无有中夭之命。 上学之士，知外国地色； 常吟咏六品之音者，则致胡老仙官卫兆之身，九年，自然得游呵罗提之国，与胡老交言，变化飞空，游行东极之境也。 东方呵罗提国： 第一品铭 音曰擅阿夷提那维。 第二品铭 音曰越家摩须云持。 第三品铭 音曰昙真释遮缘陁。 第四品铭 音曰诰波君运乌紫。 第四品铭 音曰锡晋灵法婆颐。 第六品铭 音曰舍梨定曲泥台。 东方呵罗提之国，放六品之音，置胡老之号，知者寿与天地齐龄，修行其道，则致外国仙官来卫兆身。 当以太岁、本命、八节之日，青书六品铭，服一通，东向叩齿九通，吟咏六品六徧。 毕，瞑目安身定神。 弃诸异念。 思存东方无极无穷之境，呵罗提之国，洞达了然，存胡老仙官无数众，皆来朝己行礼，诵外国之音。 便微祝曰： 天地开境，八达朗清，洞观无穷，外国之名，放品化音，结气成灵，招仙致真，亿万齐并，逆究玄微，监映无形，上下响应，内外肃清，碧霞飞轮，来辅我形，运我上升，北谒玉京。 毕，咽气九过止。 此高上放外国之品神仙上法，行之九年，则致仙官，通灵察微，与神交言，飞空腾虚，白日升天。 南方阎浮利，三十万里之外极，洞阳之野，其国音则铭伊沙他之国，国地平博，无有高下，土色如丹，广狭八十一万里。 其国人皆形长二丈四尺，寿三百六十岁。 国有六音之铭，是高上置於外国越老之品。 高上常吟歌其音，以化越老之人，令知其国有不死之教。 如其国人皆行礼而诵其音，是得三百六十岁之寿，无有中夭之命。 学者知外国地色，常吟咏六品之音者，则致仙官卫兆之身，九年，自然得游伊沙他之国，与越老交言，变化朱宫，飞行南阳之境也。 南方伊沙他国： 第一品铭 ，音曰难维那薜汉罗。 第二品铭 ，音曰桓摩罗郁蓝波。 第三品铭 ，音曰乐酆勒育明沙。 第四品铭 ，音曰回素劫起飞陁。 第五品铭 ，音曰根植遂百无和。 第六品铭 ，音曰盈冲都玄镜车。 南方伊沙他之国，放六品之音，置越老之号，知者寿与天地同年，修行其道，则致外国飞仙之官来卫兆身。 当以太岁、本命、八节之日，朱书六品之铭，入室南向而服之，叩齿九通，吟咏六音六遍。

After nine years, the Three Primes ascend to the celestial chambers, descending in cloud-borne chariots to soar through the Upper Clarity. Even if one possesses this scripture yet fails to cultivate its practice in the world, merely revering it with sincere devotion will summon twelve jade lads and twelve jade maidens to attend and guard one’s person, warding off the ten thousand calamities. They subdue weapons of war, and the thousand afflictions and myriad harms dare not rashly intrude. The Five Emperors stand guard, enabling one to attain the rank of lesser immortal. Alternatively, one may undergo bodily transformation and cyclic rebirth, ascending into the numinous chambers—though one may not yet assume office in the Jade Void or wander among the Three Clarities.

**Thirty-Six Celestial Registers of the Six Realms**

The Five Directions of Heaven and Earth each possess governing hues of hardness and softness, preventing their dissolution. The earth extends twenty billion miles deep, where it receives moisture; beneath this moisture lies another twenty billion miles of golden millet marsh; below that, twenty billion miles of adamantine iron marsh; deeper still, twenty billion miles of watery marsh; descending eighty billion miles further, one reaches the great wind marsh; and five hundred twenty billion miles beyond that, the cosmic net sustains Heaven and Earth, ensuring they do not collapse—just as the sun, moon, and stars are upheld by the wind. Scholars who remain ignorant of the depths and hues beneath the earth will find the Five Emperors unable to extend their protection beyond the borders of foreign lands.

**Eastern Realm: The Land of Fuyudai**
Beyond ninety thousand miles to the easternmost extremity lies the Wasteland of Haolin, where the kingdom of Heluoti resides. Its land is perfectly round, its soil as fresh as azure rouge, devoid of mountains or hills, spanning nine hundred thousand miles in breadth. The people of this land stand two *zhang* tall and live four hundred years. The kingdom possesses six celestial registers, which the Supreme Highest established among the foreign Hu elders. The Supreme Highest often chants these registers to transform the Hu elders, revealing to them the teachings of immortality in foreign lands. If the people of this land observe rites and recite these registers, they attain a lifespan of four hundred years, free from premature death. Scholars who study the hues of foreign lands and constantly chant the six registers will summon the immortal officials of the Hu elders to guard their persons. After nine years, they naturally gain passage to the land of Heluoti, converse with the Hu elders, transform their bodies to fly through the air, and wander the easternmost realms.

**The Six Registers of the Eastern Land of Heluoti:**
1. First Register: *Chan Ayiti Nawei*
2. Second Register: *Yue Jia Moxu Yunchi*
3. Third Register: *Tan Zhen Shizhe Yuantuo*
4. Fourth Register: *Gao Bojun Yun Wuzi*
5. Fifth Register: *Xi Jin Lingfa Poyi*
6. Sixth Register: *Sheliding Quni Tai*

In the land of Heluoti, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Hu elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth. By cultivating this Way, one summons the immortal officials of foreign lands to guard one’s person. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, one should inscribe the six registers in azure ink, recite them once while facing east, and knock the teeth nine times. Chant the six registers six times each, then close the eyes, compose the body, and settle the spirit. Abandon all stray thoughts and visualize the boundless eastern realm, the land of Heluoti, clearly and vividly. Envision countless Hu elder immortal officials arriving to pay homage, reciting the foreign registers. Then softly intone the prayer:

*"The bounds of Heaven and Earth unfold,
Eight directions shine in clarity,
Vast and boundless insight,
The names of foreign lands,
Celestial registers transform through sound,
Qi coalesces into spirit,
Summoning immortals and drawing the perfected near,
Myriad hosts gather as one,
Tracing the subtle and profound,
Mirroring the formless,
Above and below resound in harmony,
Within and without grow solemn and pure,
Azure mists and flying wheels
Come to aid my form,
Bearing me aloft,
To the northern audience in the Jade Capital."*

Conclude by swallowing the qi nine times. This is the supreme method of the celestial registers of foreign lands, a practice of divine immortals. After nine years of cultivation, one summons immortal officials, gains spiritual insight into the subtle, communicates with the divine, and ascends into the void to rise to Heaven in broad daylight.

**Southern Realm: The Land of Yanfuli**
Beyond three hundred thousand miles to the southernmost extremity lies the Radiant Yang Wilderness, where the kingdom of Yishata resides. Its land is vast and level, without elevation or depression, its soil crimson, spanning eight hundred ten thousand miles in breadth. The people of this land stand two *zhang* and four *chi* tall and live three hundred sixty years. The kingdom possesses six celestial registers, which the Supreme Highest established among the foreign Yue elders. The Supreme Highest often chants these registers to transform the Yue elders, revealing to them the teachings of immortality in their land. If the people of this land observe rites and recite these registers, they attain a lifespan of three hundred sixty years, free from premature death. Scholars who study the hues of foreign lands and constantly chant the six registers will summon the immortal officials to guard their persons. After nine years, they naturally gain passage to the land of Yishata, converse with the Yue elders, transform their bodies within the vermilion palace, and soar through the southern yang realms.

**The Six Registers of the Southern Land of Yishata:**
1. First Register: *Nan Weina Xihan Luo*
2. Second Register: *Huan Molan Yulan Bo*
3. Third Register: *Le Feng Le Yuming Sha*
4. Fourth Register: *Hui Su Jie Qi Feituo*
5. Fifth Register: *Gen Zhi Sui Bai Wuhe*
6. Sixth Register: *Ying Chong Du Xuan Jingche*

In the land of Yishata, the six registers are disseminated, and the titles of the Yue elders are established. Those who master them attain a lifespan equal to Heaven and Earth. By cultivating this Way, one summons the flying immortal officials of foreign lands to guard one’s person. On the days of the Great Year Star, one’s natal star, and the eight solar terms, inscribe the six registers in vermilion ink, enter a chamber, face south, and recite them. Knock the teeth nine times and chant the six registers six times each.

chunks.original_text: 毕，咽气九过止。 行此九年，真人下降，授兆真音，得与伧老仙官交言，乘空飞虚，上升帝晨。 高上置六国品铭，化为三十六音，元始之初，金鉼刻书其文，各置一国，今悉封於国境，或封名山五岳之洞。 如中国之音，即对玄圃积石之阴。 如此神文，皆各以紫晨玉童、太华玉女各、三百人，侍卫典香。 旧科万劫当行下世，授於上真之人，自无金名帝简，绿字玉清，不得此文。 得受六国放品之音，便得游行无穷，洞达六国之中，上天入渊，变化万方，履五岳，游名山，则胡越氐羌伧老仙官，营卫送迎，群魔伏首，兵凶灭亡，周流六国，适意所从。 诵之万遍，三元诣房，降致绿軿，飞升玉晨。 此高上自然之文，上相撰飞玄紫气之字，以雌黄书碧琼，佩身游五岳，入三清，制群魔，御万灵，威六国，伏五兵。 行之九年，真人诣庭，能飞乘虚，上造太清。 青童君曰：上帝玉真及五、岳上仙、皆服文而咏音，佩身而修真。 学无此文，则不得游名山，制六国，却甲兵，五老之官不卫身形。 为学之本，当勤行五岳，寻受此文，灵威告应，自得道真高上妙法，虽不学而仙也。 青童君受高上入六国内文，后学欲游名山，之五岳，入六国，致群仙，制万魔，伏五兵，当受五帝交音内文，佩之六年，得与六国仙官交言，自明三十六国之音也。 黄帝受隐元三行，霸天下，通神明，役鬼神，制万灵。 夏禹受交音三行，使天下鬼神禀吉凶，知宿命，得补灵仙。 曾玄受青洞文三行，匡五龙，游云宫。 安阳受九灵音三行，登帝堂，位加仙王。 赤精受宝真文，位登四极，出入三清。 王乔受苞元隐箓三行，身登上真，总领众仙，出入华房。 高上於玄圃西垄金华之宫，以化灵总众内文，以授上相青童君。 东蒙隐文真书三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则得游行东方呵罗提之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，游名山，胡老扶迎，自知六国之音，与神交言。 南方交音内文三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则得游伊沙他之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，游名山，越老之官扶将送迎，自知六国之音，与神共言。 西混青洞隐元内文三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则游入尼维罗绿那之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，出玄路，入三清，游名山，氐老扶迎，自知六国之音，与神人共言。 北九灵金光音三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则得入旬他罗之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，登广寒，谒北精，游名山，羌老扶迎，自知六国之音，与神人交言。 上清阳苞元隐录内文三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则得上游元精青沌自然之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，步空天，升玉清，游名山，万真扶迎，自然知六国之音，与神共言。 中化灵总真众内文三行，雌黄书碧缯上，佩身，则得游涉太和宝真无量之国，制群灵，斩天魔，伏五兵，入洞渊，升玄冥，戏北元，谒紫庭，游名山，则五老扶迎，自然知六国之音，与神共言。 高上入六国内隐真文，授於上相青童君，雌黄书碧缯佩身，项生宝光，映照十天，役使玉童玉女各三十六人，游行五岳，涉诸名山，入六国，履河源，所在群仙五方之官，皆来稽首，缘界司迎，制万魔，御千灵，威六国，伏五兵，变化无方，随意所从，降致飞轮丹霄紫軿，来迎我身，上升东华青宫，位登上相，总领万真。

The sounds of the Central Lands, for instance, correspond to the northern face of the Jasper Orchard’s Piled Stones. These divine texts are each attended by three hundred Purple Aurora Jade Lads and Great Flower Jade Maidens, who serve and tend the incense.

By ancient decree, after ten thousand kalpas, they are transmitted to those of the highest Perfection. Without one’s name inscribed on the Emperor’s golden tablets or the Jade Clarity’s green script, one cannot receive these texts. Upon obtaining the Six States’ ranked sounds, one may wander boundlessly, traversing the Six States, ascending to Heaven or entering the abyss, transforming in myriad ways, treading the Five Marchmounts, and roaming the sacred peaks. Then the Hu, Yue, Di, Qiang, and Qiang elder immortal officials will escort and receive, all demons bow in submission, weapons and misfortune vanish, and one may roam the Six States at will. Reciting these ten thousand times, the Three Primes visit one’s chamber, descending with green chariots to ascend to the Jade Dawn.

These are the Highest’s spontaneous texts, the Prime Minister’s soaring mysterious purple qi script, written in realgar upon azure jade, worn upon the body to wander the Five Marchmounts, enter the Three Clarities, subdue the demonic hordes, command the myriad spirits, overawe the Six States, and subjugate the five weapons. Practicing this for nine years, the Perfected One visits one’s court, enabling flight through the void to ascend to the Great Clarity.

The foundation of study lies in diligently traversing the Five Marchmounts to seek these texts, whereupon numinous might responds, and one naturally attains the Highest’s wondrous Daoist methods—even without study, one becomes immortal.

Those who later study and wish to wander the sacred peaks, the Five Marchmounts, and the Six States, summoning the host of immortals, subduing the myriad demons, and subjugating the five weapons, must receive the Five Emperors’ texts of intersecting sounds. Wearing them for six years, one may converse with the Six States’ immortal officials and naturally comprehend the thirty-six states’ sounds.

The Dao is most exalted and wondrous, the August Lord’s precious writ. The Most High has now inscribed this writ in the script of men and birds, placing it within the cavern of Penglai, upon the northern slopes of the Accumulated Stones above the Dark Garden. The dark mystery of the feathered script and the radiant splendor of its luminous patterns intermingle, illuminating the vast heavens; purple mists layer in shadow, and the brilliance of its patterns shines with penetrating clarity. By ancient decree, after ten thousand kalpas one who is destined to transmit it shall have already become a Perfected. Whoever obtains this writ shall have their rank elevated to that of Immortal Minister, able to traverse the Six States, converse with the Five Elders, and penetrate the mysteries of the Dark Void. They shall command the myriad spirits, and even without jade bones, their name shall be engraved upon the purple tablets before their birth. Those who receive this writ, though they study not, shall still become Median Immortals. Should one lightly divulge this precious incantation, their seven ancestors shall bear the burden, hauling mountains and bearing stones for ten thousand kalpas without pardon. Their own person shall be bound and subjected to the trials of the world’s winds and blades, dying to enter hell, never again to attain immortality.

When wearing this writ to wander the Six States, tread the Five Marchmounts, and traverse the myriad sacred peaks, upon reaching the border of any realm, one must first strike the teeth thirty-six times, hold the breath for thirty-six cycles, and recite the incantation:

*"Jade Perfected, lingering in circuit,
Cloud chariots soar aloft.
This day is most auspicious,
Dragons ascend, phoenixes take flight.
Arrayed in feathered regalia,
The four paths open wide,
The six hosts set forth to guide,
The ten realms come to welcome.
Immortal lads bear banners,
Jade maidens scatter incense.
The Five Elders bow in reverence,
Majestic and resplendent,
Sun and moon intertwined in sash,
Divine immortals lend their aid.
Treading the Six States,
Traversing the four quarters,
The Four Waterways and Five Marchmounts
Become bridges for my passage.
By the August Lord’s command,
Sweep away all inauspiciousness.
Wherever I journey,
All shall be most propitious.
Wondrous and strange,
The immortal’s refinement flourishes within,
The foreign lands grow luminous without,
Ascending to the Jade Capital above."*

When finished, draw in the breath thirty-six times and cease. This is the mighty incantation of the Prime Minister’s excursions, by which one governs the Six States, subdues the myriad spirits, summons immortal officials to manifest, and performs boundless transformations, ascending to the Great Clarity.

The recipient must fast for seven days, or thirty days, and during the fast present thirty-two feet of azure-patterned silk, one golden fish, one jade dragon, nine pairs of golden rings, and five taels of gold as substitutes for the oath of cutting hair and tearing cloth. The master shall face north to proclaim the covenant and transmit the writ, while the disciple receives it with reverence, adhering to the statutes of the Four Poles, gathering in solemnity and restraint, guarding the precepts in secrecy and upholding them faithfully.

The Most High Clarity’s Jade Guardian, King of the Prime Minister and Grand Marshal, commands the Master of the Lofty Dawn, the Azure Lad of the Jade Gate of the Eastern Sea, to receive this from the Most High Jade Emperor and transmit it to the Perfected of the Four Poles. The Five Thearchs’ divine soldiers shall punish those who leak its secrets, break their covenant, or betray their oath: their seven ancestors shall bear the burden, their own person shall perish, enduring the three paths and five sufferings for ten thousand kalpas without pardon.

chunks.original_text: 高上九玄三十六天内音 高上九玄空洞三十六天、洞渊九地外国放品内音者，乃生於太空九玄之先，结飞玄紫气自然之章，灵文郁乎 重霄，真光焕乎 上清，神奇表异於太汉，玉音朗激於金庭，回风流於紫烟，扬香洒於八冥，丹晖发其琼干，朱日灌其神真，流盻亿劫，虚降空玄，三素启运，九度推迁，灵音表见，刻书昆仑之山，玄圃之上积石之阴，文彩垂芒，精焕上天，日月齐其光，五星同其明，四会八达，洞彻玉清，飞仙紫童各三百人，典香待灵，佩以玃天之兽，扞以金头万重，九色流霞蔼其巅，神鸾朱凤抚其轩，五帝监真，四极典仙，七曜吐精以莹厉，玉华散真以饰尘，履阳否而不厌，经万劫而更鲜。 至中皇元年三月一日甲子，天德值合之时，上清太真玉保王上相大司马，命高晨师东海玉门青华小童君，清斋上宫九百日，青金盟天，受於高上玉帝，徧游诸天，洞鉴虚无，流眄亿津，上观无崖，中戏广员，周历六国，盘回九玄，四司鉴试，上元定仙，玉虚垂映，龟母降真，八景策辔，五老翼轩，飞仙互骋，八风奏烟，流电激威，百阳吐精，琼轮曜虚，羽盖郁玄，金童散华，玉女拂尘，众灵稽首，五岳朝真，诸天晏礼，十方司迎，总领亿道，普监万仙，位登上相，主司高晨，寔由玉帝之妙旨，三十六天之琼音，主生死於图籍，掌仙号於青宫，领金名於玄记，典白简於玉篇，上统无崖无极无穷，下摄洞渊九地万灵，五岳四极河海众仙，至三十六国，莫不咸隶於青童。 旧科万劫一传，九五之运，三代交并，当有玉名书於帝录三十六人，得见其文，得佩此音，九地灭迹，六国邀迎，三十六天书名，上宫三元下降，自然成仙。 玄典苞於洞源，灵轨巍巍乎难论，玉澳深而难测，妙化难可屡陈，略举千分之一，粗标万奇之一真也。 诸天内铭九地三十六音，以元始同存，空灵建号，结自然之名，表於九玄，演流外国三十六音。 如是天地，各有三十六分，天则有三十六天王，以应三十六国，地有三十六土皇，以应三十六天。 天王与真土皇主仙，为学不知天之内音，则天王不领兆名，不知地下之音，土皇则不灭兆迹，闭不得仙。 有见其文，受其诀音，天王玄鉴，七圣刻篇，西龟定录，东华书名，土皇灭尸落迹，九阴保举上清，五灵敬护，十界扶迎，周流六国，平灭群凶，五兵摧伏，天魔束形，九年乘空，飞行上清。 真道高妙，不得妄宣，轻泄宝音，七祖充责，己身殒亡，三涂五苦，万劫不原上真之士，慎科而行。 诸天王常以八节及月朔之日，游观无崖，历戏云房，逍遥玉清，流眄十方，於明霞之上，常咏诸天内音飞玄之章，上庆天真，内欢神衿，玉响虚朗，琼韵合音。 当此之日，五老浮位，九帝临轩，四司鉴试，五帝卫灵，众真齐唱，万仙礼音，三光停晖，七元焕明，山海静波，诸天肃清，八素散华，四皇拂尘，灵风扬香，绿霞吐津，天元溟滞，玉虚含欣，朗朗高清之馆，眇眇太漠之中，洞虚入微，周鉴无穷。 有得其道，与帝结朋，勤诵其章，位准仙王，德同诸天，寿齐三光。 凡学上仙之道，志登玉清，奉礼帝尊，而不知三十六天之音，飞玄之章，则三十六天王不领兆名，徒为精勤，天不降真，四司不敬，五帝不迎，天魔侵真，终不成仙。

The *Inner Sounds of the Nine Mysteries and Thirty-Six Heavens of the Most High* and the *Inner Sounds of the Outer Realms’ Ranks of the Thirty-Six Heavens of the Cavernous Abyss and Nine Lands* originated before the Nine Mysteries of the Great Void. There were thirty-six names inscribed in the Emperor’s register. Those who beheld its writ and wore these sounds would erase their traces in the Nine Lands, be welcomed from afar by the Six Lands, and have their names recorded in the Thirty-Six Heavens. The Three Primes of the Upper Palace would descend, and they would naturally become immortals.

The mysterious canon encompassed the cavernous source, its numinous principles towering and beyond discourse. The jade depths were profound and unfathomable, its wondrous transformations too subtle to recount repeatedly. Here, but a thousandth part is briefly raised, a single truth coarsely marked from ten thousand marvels.

After nine years, they would ride the void and fly to the Highest Clarity.

Those who lightly divulge its sacred sounds shall have their seven ancestors burdened, their own persons perish, and endure the three paths and five sufferings for ten thousand kalpas without pardon. The heavenly origin dissolves its stagnation, the Jade Void contains its joy. In the bright and lofty halls of the Highest Clarity, amidst the vast and distant Great Desert, the cavernous void enters the subtle, and all-pervading scrutiny knows no end.

Those who attain this Dao and befriend the Thearch, diligently recite its chapters, shall have their ranks equated with the Immortal Kings, their virtue equated with the various heavens, and their lifespan equated with the Three Luminaries. chunks.original_text: 天王姓王讳灵霐 第三十四洞微玄上梵炁阿竭含那天 □□ 天王姓栢讳堕世宗 第三十五玄上绿梵灭然天 □□ 天王姓朱讳陁云弥 第三十六极色上行梵泥维先若那天 □□ 天王姓袁讳员珠 四天之音，极无虚洞无色梵天，在俗虚无太清之下，空洞玄漠之中。 四天王常以八节、月朔之日，游於虚无太清无崖无极空无无色之上，诵咏四天之音飞玄之章，其日遣上真玉司四极仙王周行天下。 有学仙行道，朝礼诸天，诵经念善，斋诚奉教之人，即奏名天王，刻书九天之录，寿同四天之人，九年飞行，上升太清之中。 四天飞玄之章曰 琼霐浩澜，飞芬郁芳，三华曜日，离罗丹房，金治万丈，朱云九重，浮利吐翘，洞灌寒宫，玉仙左回，三首交通，皇上耀灵，玉华匡龙，六辔超虚，逍遥太空，携契八真，合欢天王，流眄紫霄，历运无穷，啸咏琼瑶，琳响逸充，长斋九元，二景同光，上化下变，七十四方，结我六六，与真齐双。 三十六天内名，生於空洞元气之先，文华表见题於昆仑之山，高上音其玉文，上相集其妙篇，禀受太空自然之章，上标玄图，中统六国三十六音，下总九地三十六土皇，灵篇洞畅，玉慧虚鲜，皆天王之游歌，空玄之宝章，六六韵合，四四齐真，九帝分号三十六天，万气总隶，普领群仙，上极无崖无色，下极洞源洞渊，诸为上真飞仙，不禀玉音，则不得游观无崖之天。 有得其文，天王书名，刻字紫札，结录玉晨，三十六年，克得上登无色之天，下洞九地之源。 上妙之道，不传下仙，轻泄宝音，七祖充责，身负刀山，三徒五苦，万劫不原。 洞渊九地三十六铭 第一垒色，润地正音， 土皇姓秦，讳孝景椿。 第一垒色，润地行音， 土皇姓黄，讳昌上文。 第一垒色，润地游音， 土皇姓青，讳玄文基。 第一垒色，润地梵音， 土皇姓蜚，讳忠阵皇。 右一垒之地四色土皇，地载周竟四垂不极不穷无边无际无色之气，去天九十九亿万里。 如是土皇，常以立春之日，乘青龙之车，执九色之麾，从青帝胡老之官，巨鳞之骑九千人，上诣郁单无量天，奏地仙得道上学之人，言名於四天之王。 凡修上法，当以立春之日平旦，入室东向，以青笔书上皇内音白纸上而服之，叩齿九通，仰存四土皇姓讳，悉着青羽之，头建九元通天冠，乘青龙羽车，飞行上升无量天，便咒曰： 青阳告升，土皇鉴晨，总领四司，普典万仙，天老定录，上告开陈，精勤上愿，得道无亲，愿书帝简，刻名玉篇，九垒灭迹，飞景琼轩，寿齐四皇，永保监乾。 毕，东向心拜九过，咽气九通止。 如此则土皇列名九天九地，灭迹九阴，地官营卫，胡老司迎，三十六年，得乘青羽飞舆，上升无量之天。 第二垒刚，色地正音， 土皇姓戊，讳坤文光。 第二垒刚，色地行音， 土皇姓郁，讳黄母生。 第二垒刚色地游音， 土皇姓玄，讳乾德维。 第二垒刚色地梵音， 土皇姓长，讳皇萌。 右二垒之地四色土皇，地载周竟四垂不极不穷无边无际无色之气，去第一垒八十一亿万里。 如是第二垒土皇，常以春分之日，乘黄碧二色之气，十二玄龟执神皇九元之策，从青帝胡老之官，飞行甲骑八千人，上诣上上禅善无量寿天，奏地仙得道上学之人，言名於四天之王。

Flying fragrance lush and dense,

Passing through kalpas without end,
Whistling and chanting jade and jasper,

Perpetual fast of the Nine Origins,
Dual luminaries shine as one,
Above transforming, below transmuting,
Seventy-four directions,
We bind our six sixes,
To pair with the Perfected as one.

To the right: the nine strata of the earth’s ultimate depths, the Abyssal Cavern’s source, the Rigid Axis of Heaven and Earth, governs so that one does not fall. Above, it is five hundred twenty billion *li* from the first stratum; below, it is boundless, without end or border, all pervaded by the qi of the Rigid Axis. The Earth Sovereigns of the ninth stratum, on the first day of the third month, the second day of the sixth month, the third day of the ninth month, and the fourth day of the twelfth month—four times a year—ride a five-colored cloud chariot, nine-colored flying dragons bearing the writ of the Central Origin’s life-spirit, accompanied by the Elder Immortal Officials, a radiant heavenly host of twelve thousand feathered riders, ascending to the *Pāriyātraka* Heaven to report the names of those who have attained immortality through the nine earths’ Dao. For those studying the superior method, on these days enter the chamber, face the Grand Year Star, inscribe in yellow on white paper the inner tones of the four Earth Sovereigns and wear them, strike the teeth twelve times, and visualize the surnames and personal names of the four Earth Sovereigns, all clad in dark and yellow five-colored robes, heads crowned with the Nine Origins Heaven-Penetrating Treasure Coronet, feet shod in five-colored slippers woven with lion patterns, bearing the life-preserving talisman of the tattooed body, riding a yellow auroral flying chariot, accompanied by thirty-six Jade Maidens of the Five Thearchs, flying upward to ascend to the *Pāriyātraka* Heaven. Then recite the incantation:

The Two Images revolve in cycles,
the Nine Essences penetrate the numinous.
The Elder Thearchs respond to the tally,
soaring through the void to enter clarity.
Fourfold connections, eightfold thoroughfares,
flying auroras and purple jades.
Ascending to the Golden Flower,
paying homage before the Emperor’s numen.
Inscribed in the immortal register,
names carved in the Azure Palace.
Attaining the Dao’s white writ,
sealed with the seven numina.
The nine strata extinguish the corpse,
the Eastern Well refines the form.
The Three Origins descend the perfected,
my Dao is now luminous.
I attain the flying effulgence,
ascending to the Jade Court.

Upon completion, bow nine times in the heart and swallow qi twelve times to conclude. Practicing this for thirty-six years, one attains the yellow auroral flying chariot and ascends to the *Pāriyātraka* Heaven. The nine earths and nine strata descend ninefold, corresponding to thirty-six tones and thirty-six Earth Sovereigns, aligning above with the thirty-six heavens and at the center with the thirty-six states. These Earth Sovereigns all hold ranks equal to the Jade Emperor’s title, differing only in the division of qi they govern and the distinctions of their names above and below. Every thirty-six years, the Earth Sovereigns transform their titles, ascending to the Upper Clarity Palace to inherit the rulership of the thirty-six heavens. The officials of the Jade Bureau, beneath the nine strata, all report the names of those who have attained immortality through the Dao to the Nine Heavens’ Heavenly Kings. Those who study without knowing the inner names of the nine strata’ earth tones and thirty-six Earth Sovereigns will not have their traces extinguished in the nine earths; the Nine Heavens’ Chancellor will not accept their names, the Five Marchmounts will not descend cloud chariots, the Five Thearchs will not protect their bodies, and though they may master foreign tones, they will not ascend through the empty void.

Thus, Heaven, Earth, and Human each receive the qi of the three threes, and only when the three unite as the perfected can one attain immortality. Those who know the inner names of the nine earths’ tones and thirty-six Earth Sovereigns will have the Nine Qi Elder constantly guarded by four directions’ five-colored numinous officials, protecting their bodies in all movements, ascending and traversing the Five Marchmounts. Immortal officials will attend and escort them, dispelling demonic trials, summoning divine perfected beings, flying through the void in nine years, sitting in disappearance and standing in vanishing. In thirty years, they will ascend to the Great Clarity. Those who possess this text in the world will have the Seven Mysteries’ Ancestor serve as the Nine Qi Life-Spirit Earth Sovereign’s official, safeguarding their forms, comforting their souls, and driving away the *Hao Li* elders and Earth Chancellor’s karmic entanglements, freeing them from confinement, punishment, and servitude. Dwelling in the world, they will be secure and free from misfortune; the twelve guardian generals will encamp and defend the eight gates, connecting with the perfected and summoning the divine. They may become wealthy if they wish, attain office if they wish, become immortals if they wish, or become divine if they wish.

This Dao is secret and wondrous, not to be idly spoken of. The Highest Oral Instructions and Precious Scrolls of the Upper Minister Azure Lad are transmitted only to those who receive them. Recklessly divulging the numinous text will condemn one’s seven ancestors to servitude, irredeemable for ten thousand kalpas. When ascending mountains to dwell or settling in a residence, to discern the land’s auspiciousness or inauspiciousness, on a *wu* or *ji* day, inscribe in yellow the thirty-six earth tones of the nine strata on white paper and place it at the center of the dwelling, covering it with a basin. After three nights, uncover and examine it: if the paper is moist and yellow, it is greatly auspicious; if it is green, there are dead spirits’ corpses below; if it is white, it is inauspicious.

**The Land of Heluoti in the East:**
First Inscription: The true tone is *Wu Yi*.

Sixth Inscription: The true tone is *Yun Zhi*.

Beyond nine hundred thousand *li* east of the Middle Kingdom lies the Land of Heluoti, also called the Star Realm. Beyond its borders stands Fusang, amid the Azure Sea, spanning ten thousand *li*. Atop it stands the Palace of the Supreme Emperor, a secondary abode of the Perfected True King. There grows an upper-born forest resembling mulberry trees, each towering thousands of *zhang*, the largest three thousand *wei* in girth. They grow in pairs from the same root, bearing crimson fruit like mulberries, which immortals consume. Their bodies take on a golden radiance, and their fruit ripens but once every nine thousand years.

Further out lies Shengzhou, beyond Fusang, bordering Penglai to the west. Its land spans two thousand five hundred *li*, twenty-three thousand *li* from shore, and is home to tens of thousands of immortals. The land knows no cold or heat, its climate ever temperate, and abounds with divine transcendent herbs. Those who consume them may soar through the air.

East of Fusang lies Zuzhou, amid the Eastern Sea, spanning five hundred *li*, seven thousand *li* from shore. Upon it grows the herb of immortality, resembling wild rice shoots, three to four *chi* in length, also called the *Yangshen Zhi* (Nurturing-Spirit Mushroom). Its leaves resemble those of wild rice, growing not in clusters but singly. One who consumes a single stalk may ascend to the Upper Clarity in flight. Even the dead may be revived if covered with it—truly a wondrous and divine medicine. Those who enter this land must know its name. By meditating upon the immortal official Hu Lao and gathering the herb from Zuzhou, visualizing its color and ingesting it, after three years one’s face will radiate flowing light, and life will extend for ten thousand years. Over time, immortals will naturally bestow this divine substance, delivering it to the practitioner.

**The Land of Yishatuo in the South:**
First Inscription: The true tone is *Ying Hua*.
Second Inscription: The true tone is *Wang Jia*.
Third Inscription: The true tone is *Wo Mo*.
Fourth Inscription: The true tone is *Yao Pa*.
Fifth Inscription: The true tone is *Wu Du*.
Sixth Inscription: The true tone is *Fei Pu*.

Beyond eighty-one thousand *li* south of the Middle Kingdom lies the farthest reaches of Jambudvīpa, the wilds of Dongyang, the Land of Yishatuo, also called the Celestial Fire Court of Tianzhu. There grow great trees, three thousand *zhang* tall and two thousand *wei* in girth, abundant with divine medicines, sweet nectar, and jade blossoms—nothing is lacking. Its inhabitants live for three hundred and sixty years. There are also spirit foxes, as large as dogs, their fur in five colors. Their cries resound for four thousand *li*, and their majesty subdues tigers, leopards, and all beasts. Those who wear their fur live as long as heaven and earth.

To the left stands Wind Mountain, where constant rumbling echoes. Atop it lies the Purple Mansion Palace, where divine transcendent jade maidens wander and observe. Further lies Yanzhou, at the center of the Southern Sea, spanning two thousand *li*, nine thousand *li* from shore. Upon it dwells the Wind-Born Beast, resembling a leopard, blue in color, and as large as a wildcat. Its body blazes with fire that reaches the heavens, burning for months without dying, its fur unscorched. Blades cannot pierce it, and only after striking its head thousands of times with an iron hammer does it perish. If it opens its mouth to the wind, it revives in moments. Plugging its nostrils with *shi shang changpu* (stone-surface calamus) kills it. Taking its brain and mixing it with chrysanthemum blossoms to consume grants life as enduring as heaven and earth.

There is also Fire Forest Mountain, where the Fire-Light Beast dwells, as large as a rat, its fur three to four *cun* long, either red or white. Gazing at the mountain’s forests and these beasts at midnight, their light shines like burning flames. Weaving their fur into cloth produces *huohuan bu* (fire-washed cloth). If slightly soiled, burning it restores its freshness. The people of Yishatuo wear this cloth, and immortals descend in its likeness. Scholars who meditate upon the land’s tones and contemplate the immortal official Yue Lao for thirty-six years will have divine beings present these beasts and other wondrous treasures of the land to them.

chunks.original_text: 得衣其毛，寿同天地。 学者存其国音，氐老仙官三十六年，当献送昆吾之剑，吉光之兽於兆也。 北方旬他罗之国 第一品铭 ，音曰玄家。 第二品铭 ，音曰文多。 第三品铭 ，音曰山芦。 第四品铭 ，音曰武都。 第五品铭 ，音曰盈家。 第六品铭 ，音曰玄摩。 北方去中国分五万里外，名郁单下极朔阴钩陈之庭，国名旬他罗之国，一名天镜之国，国人寿三百岁。 国外则有玄洲，方七千二百里，四面是海，去岸三十六万里，上有太玄都，仙伯真公所治。 有寿鸳之鸟，如浮气，多丘山，名为风山，与天西北门连界，金堂玉室宫府，生金玉紫芝，是三天所治。 其外则有元洲，地方三千里，去南岸十万里，上生五芝玄涧，涧水如蜜，饮之与天地同年。 中有三万仙家，悉饮此水，得仙不死。 学者存其国音，羌老仙官三十六年，献降玄涧五芝水也。 上方元精青沌自然之国： 第一品铭 ，正音重欢。 第二品铭 ，正音玉金。 第三品铭 ，正音三林。 第四品铭 ，正音正精。 第五品铭 ，正音吸钤。 第六品铭 ，正音绿婴。 上方九天之上，清阳恢空之内，无色无象无形无影空洞之铭，元精清沌自然之国，一名洞澳清衍之国，以清气为芬世，上极无穷，四覆诸天，惟有玉虚紫馆，结空洞之烟，在虚玄青沌之内也。 为学存高上之音，则天人授子飞仙之方。 中方太和宝真无量之国： 第一品铭 ，正音山芦 第二品铭 ，正音世家。 第三品铭 ，正音嵯峨。 第四品铭 ，正音盈华。 第五品铭 ，正音翟葩。 第六品名 ，正音罗那。 中国四周百二十亿万里，下极大风泽五百二十亿万里，昆仑处其中央，弱水周匝绕山，山高平地三万六千里，上三角，面方长万里，形似偃盆，中狭上广。 其一角正北，干辰星之精，名阆风台； 一角正西，名曰玄圃台； 其一角正东，名曰昆仑宫。 一处有积金，为天墉城，面方千里，城上安金台五所，玉楼十二，其北户山承渊山，并其支辅。 又有墉城、金台玉楼，相似如一，流精之阙，光碧之堂，琼华之室，紫翠丹房，景云烛日，朱霞九光，西王母之所治。 上通璇玑，元气流布，五常玉衡，普引九天之澳灌，万仙之宗根，天地之纽，万度之柄矣。 上生金银之树，琼柯丹宝之林，垂苏瑰以为枝，结玉精以为实，其树悉刻题三十六国音诸天内文，上楼紫驽、凤鸾、白雀、朱鹗、鹍鸡、灵鹄、赤鸟、青鹊，下则飞禽游兽，与昆仑同生，初无死耗。 但玄文宝经，隐书古字，有千二百亿万言，在玄圃之上，积石之阴，仙人有九万人，皆停散於灵山。 学者常诵诸天内音，外国三十六音，地下九垒之音，九年，仙人自当降送灵山之神奇，三十六年，得乘五色云舆，上登昆仑之山也。 高上告上相青童君：凡诸天文三十六国九地之音，皆玄古空洞之书，自然之章，悉是上真帝皇以下，及学仙得道，莫不受音於太真，佩文以游行，威制万灵，摄魔召精，登涉五岳，及入三军，皆九天卫迎，四司扶侍，九年，三元诣房，三十六年，天降云舆，飞行上清。 受其音，以青缯为地，黄笔书文。 以甲子之日夜半，於中庭露醮，以随时珍果、清酒三斗，设以九盘九杯，施九尺青罗之内，以设诸文。 弟子赍上金九两，纹之缯三十六尺，南向而伏。

Five hundred thousand *li* north of the Middle Kingdom lies the extreme of the northern darkness, the court of the Celestial Curtain—known as the Land of Xunta Luo, or the Land of the Heavenly Mirror. Its people live three hundred years. Beyond its borders lies Xuanzhou, spanning seven thousand two hundred *li*, surrounded by seas thirty-six thousand *li* from shore. Above stands the Great Mysterious Capital, governed by the Immortal Lord Zhen Gong. There dwells the Longevity Mandarin Duck, resembling floating mist. Many hills rise there, called Wind Mountain, which borders the northwestern gate of heaven. Its halls and chambers are of gold and jade, yielding golden jade and purple lingzhi, governed by the Three Heavens.

Beyond it lies Yuanzhou, spanning three thousand *li*, ten thousand *li* from its southern shore. There grow the Five Lingzhi of the Mysterious Gorge, whose waters flow like honey. Drinking them grants life equal to heaven and earth. Thirty thousand immortals dwell there, all drinking this water to attain deathless transcendence. Those who master the land’s speech shall, after thirty-six years as an elder immortal official, offer the Five Lingzhi Water of the Mysterious Gorge.

Above the Nine Heavens, within the vast emptiness of pure yang, where form and shadow dissolve into the void—there lies the Land of Primordial Essence and Pristine Chaos, also called the Land of the Abyssal Azure Expanse. It is a world perfumed by pure *qi*, boundless above, covering all heavens below. Only the Jade Void and Purple Pavilion weave mist through the hollow emptiness, nestled within the Pristine Azure Chaos. Those who master the loftiest celestial speech shall receive from the heavens the method of ascending as a flying immortal.

The Middle Kingdom spans one hundred twenty million *li* in circumference, its depths reaching the Great Wind Marsh five hundred twenty million *li* across. At its center stands Kunlun, encircled by weak waters. The mountain rises thirty-six thousand *li* above the plain, its summit triangular, each face ten thousand *li* in length, shaped like an inverted basin—narrow at the waist, broad above. One peak points due north, infused with the essence of the Chen star, called the Terrace of Soaring Winds. Another faces west, named the Terrace of the Mysterious Garden. The third points east, called the Kunlun Palace. In one place, gold accumulates to form the Celestial Rampart City, a thousand *li* on each side. Upon it stand five golden terraces and twelve jade towers. To the north lie the Mountain of the Northern Gate and the Mountain of the Abyssal Spring, along with their subsidiary peaks. There are also rampart cities, golden terraces, and jade towers, all identical in splendor—gleaming towers of refined essence, halls of luminous azure, chambers of jasper radiance, vermilion chambers of purple and cinnabar, where rosy clouds illuminate the sun and crimson auroras glow with ninefold brilliance. Here rules the Queen Mother of the West. Above, it connects to the Celestial Mechanism, where primordial *qi* flows and spreads. The Five Constants and Jade Balance universally guide the influx from the Nine Heavens’ abysses, serving as the root of myriad immortals, the pivot of heaven and earth, the handle of all measures.

Gold and silver trees grow here, forests of jade branches and cinnabar treasures, their boughs draped in resplendent tassels, their fruits formed of refined jade. Each tree is inscribed with the thirty-six celestial scripts of the heavens and the languages of the thirty-six lands. Above soar purple falcons, phoenixes, white sparrows, vermilion owls, *kun* pheasants, spirit magpies, red birds, and azure magpies. Below, flying birds and wandering beasts thrive alongside Kunlun, never knowing death or decay. Yet the sacred texts of the Mysterious Scriptures and the hidden writings of ancient characters—comprising one thousand two hundred million words—lie upon the northern slope of the Accumulated Stones in the Mysterious Garden. Ninety thousand immortals dwell there, scattered across the numinous mountain. Those who recite the celestial sounds of the heavens, the thirty-six languages of foreign lands, and the nine subterranean tones for nine years shall have immortals descend to bestow the mountain’s divine wonders. After thirty-six years, they shall ascend Kunlun upon a five-colored cloud chariot.

The Most High addresses the Supreme Minister, the Azure Youth: All celestial writings of the thirty-six lands and nine earthly realms are the primordial, hollow, and empty scriptures—natural chapters of the highest truth. From the Supreme Thearch and the Imperial Sovereigns below, to those who study immortality and attain the Dao, none fail to receive these sounds from the Supreme Truth. Bearing these texts in their travels, they command the awe of all spirits, subdue demons, summon essences, traverse the Five Peaks, and enter the Three Armies—always escorted by the Nine Heavens’ guards, attended by the Four Directors. After nine years, they ascend to the Three Origins’ chambers. After thirty-six years, heaven sends a cloud chariot to carry them aloft into the Upper Clarity.

To receive these sounds, use azure silk as the ground and a yellow brush to inscribe the text. On the night of the *jiazi* day, at midnight, perform an open-air libation in the central courtyard. Offer seasonal delicacies, three *dou* of clear wine, nine plates, and nine cups, arranged within a nine-*chi* square of azure silk. Present the texts accordingly. The disciple shall offer nine taels of gold and thirty-six *chi* of figured silk, prostrating toward the south.
